channel.title: jimgrisham tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from jimgrisham.

item.description: ‚ÄúDiscussing how #Russia is governed we talk a lot about politics, ideology, religion. And yet, we pay too little attention to the economy of power. Russian regimes typically focus on two tasks: 1Producing tradable goods (=raw materials) 2Exporting them‚Äù #history #Muscovy https://t.co/zO5m6A1Ihp
@30de2e4d6c4f416 @Osinttechnical They‚Äôre likely never leaving Russian airspace.

@Lifaccordng2kat @juliaioffe Industrial demand is the most significant. For individuals with the option, for example, perhaps:
- fewer discretionary driving vacations (or vacations closer to home) - carpooling to work - leaving / later earlier to avoid traffic - using a more fuel-efficient vehicle
@PLT_cheater @Emmy_Trashfire @AscendingRamona Hey, that sounds kind of like what happened when SSL certificates became inexpensive (and eventually free)!

@WildGoo69031318 @juliaioffe We‚Äôre not importing gas, though, we‚Äôre importing oil. Any effects will be spread against all users of the refined products, and more elastic end-users (e.g. aluminum smelters) will likely cause prices to stabilize before actions by more inelastic gasoline users.
@KevinRothrock @YaleSOM Those that won‚Äôt close for whatever reason should be lobbied to _at least_ donate any profits earned in Russia since the start of the war‚Ä¶
@Lucas_Hofmann_ @robert_bruce_iv @ErrantStrategry @RALee85 @Osinttechnical Any ‚ÄúRU victory‚Äù that occurs does seem like it will be quite pyrrhic, regardless of timing. https://t.co/7qPa6qJvzn

@ThordaksMommy @RonWenig @mehdirhasan #ITER construction is far along. -> operation 2025-2035+ See, e.g.: @iterorg @fusionforenergy -> First commercial prototype designs 10 years later? -> Wide adoption maybe by 2075? (_maybe_ 2065 if we‚Äôre lucky/committed?) See also #SPARC project by @mit_nse / @CFS_Energy
@LaurenKGurley @jmkorhonen Amazon pays for fuel and ‚Äú10¬¢ per delivery‚Äù!?! Did I mis-read that?
Amazon pays for fuel and ‚Äú10¬¢ per delivery‚Äù!?! Did I mis-read that? https://t.co/4Ndt0glP4z
Very interesting thread‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs worth reading from the top: https://t.co/qJAJfTUCgi
@YellowAfterlife @krisnova Just government websites (ostensibly to prevent DDOS and defacement attacks) or commercial / private ones as well?

@MSzafranski413 @DanLamothe Keep in mind someone saying they ‚Äúcannot corroborate‚Äù something doesn‚Äôt mean they can‚Äôt have detailed confirmed intelligence on a topic. Not having permission to corroborate something can also result in that response, and the IC will ultimately share only what it wants to share.
@iyad_elbaghdadi There‚Äôs also a Youtube link in the replies: https://t.co/z3degSam5n
@PetrolePassion @UAWeapons ATC showed at least one large Spanish military cargo plane arriving within the past 8 hours‚Ä¶ and based on recent angry talk from the Kremlin‚Ä¶ yes.
